msItem.filiation: Based on ÆCHom I, 19 and other sources, including ÆCHom I, 1, and parts of Napier homilies V, XIX, XL, XXIV, and LVII, as described in Ker p. 344. Ker believes the MS was once part of Cleo B. xiii.

handNote.p: Main hand. An 'Exeter' type hand, probably identical with a hand in Cleop. B.xiii. Three forms of s used, double s sometimes written long s followed by low s; þonne is abbreviated after double n. Ker thinks this is hand (his hand 4) is different from the preceeding item. We disagree.
